dmca.title: [EV1-C1325982Q] Trademark/Copyright infringement
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] Posted At: Thursday, October 12, 2006 5:35 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [EV1-C1325982Q] Trademark/Copyright infringement Subject: [EV1-C1325982Q] Trademark/Copyright infringement ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Trademark/Copyright infringement Added by system at Thursday, Oct 12 2006 09:26 am X-MailFrom: melissal@ECOQUESTINTL.NET X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [70.87.6.111] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Thu Oct 12 10:24:31 2006 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Thu, 12 Oct 2006 10:24:20 -0500 Return-path: Delivery-date: Thu, 12 Oct 2006 10:24:21 -0500 Received: from mx01.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.180] helo=mx01.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from melissal@ECOQUESTINTL.NET) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GY2Q0-0004Xn-UU for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 12 Oct 2006 10:24:21 -0500 Received: from mail.ecoquestintl.net ([65.244.90.180]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from melissal@ECOQUESTINTL.NET) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GY2Pw-000ALi-TS for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 12 Oct 2006 10:24:17 -0500 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C6EE12.97F175A6" Subject: Trademark/Copyright infringement Date: Thu, 12 Oct 2006 11:25:05 -0400 Message-ID: <008A071CE992C0429A0004DBBA12816F034C0DEA@ecomail1.ecoquest.com> X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Trademark/Copyright infringement Thread-Index: AcbuEpePlfW9eMQqRWeYMAqqhIm6aQ== From: "Melissa Lovell" To: Received-SPF: softfail (mx01.filter.theplanet.com: transitioning domain of ECOQUESTINTL.NET does not designate 65.244.90.180 as permitted sender) client-ip=65.244.90.180; envelope-from=melissal@ECOQUESTINTL.NET; helo=mail.ecoquestintl.net; X-OriginalArrivalTime: 12 Oct 2006 15:24:20.0845 (UTC) FILETIME=[7D7799D0:01C6EE12] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) October 12, 2006 ThePlanet.com Internet Services Inc. 1333 North Stemmons Freeway Suite 110 Dallas, TX 75207 Dear Sir or Madam: EcoQuest International is a manufacturer and seller of a number of products, including air and water purification systems. EcoQuest has a number of registered and pending trademarks for its business, including the following: ECOTECH, No. 2877232 ECOQUEST, No. 3062066 SYNAIRG, No. 2962346 FRESH AIR BY ECOQUEST, No. 250522 EcoQuest also has the copyright to a variety of images, graphics and textual material related to its products, some of which may be found at www.ecoquest.com and www.ecoquestintl.com/index_home.asp. EcoQuest sells its products exclusively through authorized dealers. Only products purchased through an authorized channel are covered by EcoQuest's three-year warranty. Unfortunately, a number of unauthorized resellers of EcoQuest products do not disclose the absence of warranty coverage to the buyer, or expressly or implicitly indicate that the products they sell are covered by EcoQuest's warranty. These false and misleading statements and actions dilute and adversely impact the value of EcoQuest's trademarks, and violate the Lanham Act. It has come to our attention that materials are being hosted and made available to the consuming public on your Internet network, system or service that infringe upon certain of EcoQuest's above-identified trademarks and copyrights in this fashion. This use is not authorized by EcoQuest or any agent or representative of EcoQuest. The infringing materials may be found at www.cleansingdecision.com and www.freshair-utah.com . The infringement consists of the failure to state that the goods are not warrantied by EcoQuest, which creates a false impression that EcoQuest warranties the goods being sold. This is in violation of the Lanham Act, and dilutes and adversely impacts the value of EcoQuest's trademarks. In addition, the following web pages contain materials which infringe upon EcoQuest's copyrights in its images, graphics and/or textual material: http://www.freshair-utah.com/trial.html http://www.freshair-utah.com/technology.html http://www.cleansingdecision.com/causes.html http://www.cleansingdecision.com/symptoms.html http://www.cleansingdecision.com/freshair.html http://www.cleansingdecision.com/trial.html http://www.cleansingdecision.com/technology.html In addition, I would like to add that the text within this site contains statements that use the word "our" or "we" with regard to EcoQuest's trademarks and technology. These false statements confirm the impression in the minds of the consumer that the site is an official EcoQuest site and the product sales are from EcoQuest, when they are not. Examples of some (but not all) of these false statements include: http://www.freshair-utah.com/freshair.html http://www.cleansingdecision.com/technology.html As you no doubt are aware, the safe-harbors for Internet service providers under the Communications Decency Act (CDA) and/or the Digital Millenium Copyright Act (DMCA) does not work to protect such entities against direct or contributory infringement of intellectual property such as trademarks. Accordingly, we request that you immediately: (1) remove all web sites or pages, including the site or page identified above, that contain any of the above-described trademarks or copyrighted material; (2) cease any activities that infringe EcoQuest's intellectual property rights; and (3) prevent any web sites or pages such as those described herein from being hosted or otherwise made available on any system, service, network, or pages you provide or host. The information contained in this letter is accurate. Under penalty of perjury, I state that I am authorized to act on behalf of EcoQuest, which is the owner of exclusive copyright, trademark and other Lanham Act rights that are being infringed as described above. I may be contacted at the e-mail address shown above. EcoQuest would appreciate receiving a confirmation, within 15 days of the date of this letter, that you are taking prompt and appropriate action to terminate the above-described infringement. Sincerely, Melissa Lovell, manager Media & Ethics Department EcoQuest International melissal@ecoquestintl.net MIME element (text/html)

October 12, 2006

 

ThePlanet.com Internet Services Inc.

1333 North Stemmons Freeway

Suite 110

Dallas, TX   75207

 

Dear Sir or Madam:

         ;    EcoQuest International is a manufacturer and seller of a number of products, including air and water purification systems.  EcoQuest has a number of registered and pending trademarks for its business, including the following:

         ;    ECOTECH, No. 2877232

         ;    ECOQUEST, No. 3062066

         ;    SYNAIRG, No. 2962346

         ;    FRESH AIR BY ECOQUEST, No. 250522

         ;   

 

EcoQuest also has the copyright to a variety of images, graphics and textual material related to its products, some of which may be found at www.ecoquest.com and www.ecoquestintl.com/index_home.asp.

         ;    EcoQuest sells its products exclusively through authorized dealers. Only products purchased through an authorized channel are covered by EcoQuest's three-year warranty.   Unfortunately, a number of unauthorized resellers of EcoQuest products do not disclose the absence of warranty coverage to the buyer, or expressly or implicitly indicate that the products they sell are covered by EcoQuest's warranty.  These false and misleading statements and actions dilute and adversely impact the value of EcoQuest's trademarks, and violate the Lanham Act.  

         ;    It has come to our attention that materials are being hosted and made available to the consuming public on your Internet network, system or service that infringe upon certain of EcoQuest's above-identified trademarks and copyrights in this fashion.  This use is not authorized by EcoQuest or any agent or representative of EcoQuest.

         ;    The infringing materials may be found at www.cleansingdecision.com and www.freshair-utah.com. &nb sp;  The infringement consists of the failure to state that the goods are not warrantied by EcoQuest, which creates a false impression that EcoQuest warranties the goods being sold.  This is in violation of the Lanham Act, and dilutes and adversely impacts the value of EcoQuest's trademarks.

             In addition, the following web pages contain materials which infringe upon EcoQuest's copyrights in its images, graphics and/or textual material:

http://www.freshair-utah. com/trial.html

http://www.freshair- utah.com/technology.html

http://www.cleansing decision.com/causes.html

http://www.cleansi ngdecision.com/symptoms.html

http://www.cleansi ngdecision.com/freshair.html

http://www.cleansingd ecision.com/trial.html

http://www.clean singdecision.com/technology.html

 

         ;    In addition, I would like to add that the text within this site contains statements that use the word “our” or “we” with regard to EcoQuest’s trademarks and technology.  These false statements confirm the impression in the minds of the consumer that the site is an official EcoQuest site and the product sales are from EcoQuest, when they are not.

Examples of some (but not all) of these false statements include:

http://www.freshair-ut ah.com/freshair.html

http://www.clean singdecision.com/technology.html

      ;       As you no doubt are aware, the safe-harbors for Internet service providers under the Communications Decency Act (CDA) and/or the Digital Millenium Copyright Act (DMCA) does not work to protect such entities against direct or contributory infringement of intellectual property such as trademarks.  Accordingly, we request that you immediately: (1) remove all web sites or pages, including the site or page identified above, that contain any of the above-described trademarks or copyrighted material; (2) cease any activities that infringe EcoQuest's intellectual property rights; and (3) prevent any web sites or pages such as those described herein from being hosted or otherwise made available on any system, service, network, or pages you provide or host.

The information contained in this letter is accurate.  Under penalty of perjury, I state that I am authorized to act on behalf of EcoQuest, which is the owner of exclusive copyright, trademark and other Lanham Act rights that are being infringed as described above.  I may be contacted at the e-mail address shown above.

         ;    EcoQuest would appreciate receiving a confirmation, within 15 days of the date of this letter, that you are taking prompt and appropriate action to terminate the above-described infringement. 

 

Sincerely,

 

 

 

Melissa Lovell, manager

Media & Ethics Department

EcoQuest International

melissal@ecoquestintl.net

 

MIME element (text/plain)
